title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
jvelociter left at 00:02 (Quit: jvelociter  
headache left at 00:24 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 00:44  
sdumitriu - (01:54): CalebJamesDeLisl: You're Awesome!  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:55): What did I do this time :/  
sdumitriu - (01:55): Nothing in particular  
sdumitriu - (01:55): I just like your way of life  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:55): Thanks.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:57): While we're chatting, I was thinking wouldn't it be cool to add an api function to allow an application programmer to do things in the security context of the author?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:57): Like programming rights but without them.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:57): saving a document that the viewer can't save etc.  
sdumitriu - (01:57): You mean something like saveWithProgrammingRights?  
sdumitriu - (01:58): (it's in api.Document)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:58): Yes but for subwiki admins, since programming rights is global AFAIK...  
sdumitriu - (01:59): That's a bit dangerous  
sdumitriu - (01:59): Maybe a saveWithAdminRights  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:59): I don't see why my scripts shouldn't be able to do what I can do.  
sdumitriu - (01:59): Or no, actually that would be useful and not very dangerous  
sdumitriu - (01:59): So I'm +0.5 at the moment  
sdumitriu - (02:00): A new parameter to the script macro?  
sdumitriu - (02:00): We already have the context param  
sdumitriu - (02:01): Or not? Hm, lets check  
sdumitriu - (02:01): No, no context parameter  
sdumitriu - (02:01): (I was confusing with the include macro)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:02): I had been thinking maybe xwiki.api.Api.switchSecurityContext  (that's a weird name, but that's the idea)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:03): or api.XWiki.switchSecurityContext since it isn't needed for doc and xcontext  
sdumitriu - (02:03): But we must take care of the following two scenarios (document A includes document B as a sheet):  
sdumitriu - (02:03): - A is privileged, B is not, B switches context  
sdumitriu - (02:03): - B is privileged, A is not, A switches context  
sdumitriu - (02:03): Who is the author?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:04): The author must be the author of the included document otherwise rights leak.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:10): - A is privileged, B is not, B switches context   -   B switches to context of B's author, or to context of current viewer.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:14): - B is privileged, A is not, A switches context    -   option 1. B is executed in the context of B's author (which might break the script)  option 2. context switches back to viewer so that B is executed as it expects to be.  
jfx joined #xwiki at 02:29  
jfx - (02:31): I just posted a patch, but did not adjust indentation for an else-wrap trough all the old code.  
jfx - (02:31): Is that important?  
jfx - (02:33): I dont feel it offers any improvement in readability, when the indentation would just shift code two spaces right trough more than a page of code.  
sdumitriu - (02:34): jfx: For XWIKI-4928, or which one?  
jfx - (02:34): Hm... maybe I fail. Is there something similar to php die() in velocity?  
sdumitriu - (02:34): #stop  
jfx - (02:35): Yes, that's the one.  
jfx - (02:35): oh, gonna fix that then.  
jfx - (02:36): #if !hasprogramming (then show warning) then #stop.  
jfx - (02:36): shoud be better than wrap the rest in #else  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:37): Does #stop stop endpage.vm from parsing?  
sdumitriu - (02:37): CalebJamesDeLisl: In 1.0 yes, but in 2.0 I think it just stops the current {{velo}} macro  
sdumitriu - (02:37): I'll have to test  
sdumitriu - (02:38): Hm, actually it stops everything  
sdumitriu - (02:38): That's a bit wrong  
jfx - (02:39): Hm, so it's a no-go for #stop atm?  
sdumitriu - (02:39): Indeed  
sdumitriu - (02:39): I only use it when right before it is a $response.sendRedirect  
jfx - (02:40): Allright, that means I'm off the hook for tonight. :)  
jfx - (02:40): Thanks \*\_^  
sdumitriu - (02:40): jfx: If it's a big portion of code on an #else branch, it's not mandatory to indent it  
jfx - (02:41): Great to hear  
sdumitriu - (02:42): jfx: A few commens on the patch  
jfx - (02:42): sure  
sdumitriu - (02:42): Try not to introduce blank lines, since they end up as paragraphs  
sdumitriu - (02:42): For example here:  
sdumitriu - (02:42): -#if(!$xwiki.hasProgrammingRights()) -  {{warning}}This document requires programming rights and needs to be saved by an administrator of this Wiki{{/warning}} -#end +  
sdumitriu - (02:44): Second, I don't remember what XWikiTeam is supposed to accomplish, but I think it's required  
sdumitriu - (02:44): The rest of the changes are good  
jfx - (02:45): XWikiTeam was not required when I tested. And isnt it strange to have a page owned by a non-existen user?  
sdumitriu - (02:45): XPANELS-121 looks good  
jfx - (02:45): In fact, it'll break since it does not have programming rights.  
jfx - (02:46): Ah, xwikibot. You are teh bug. (clicked it)  
sdumitriu - (02:46): I think that it's supposed to be automatically transformed into "superadmin", which always has programming rights, but I'm not sure (jvelociter did this, he'll be able to confirm tomorrow)  
sdumitriu - (02:47): Jira is wrong, the xmlrpc connection seems broken  
jfx - (02:47): sdumitriu: I'm fixing the extra lines in the meantime, should I upload it or wait for his comment?  
sdumitriu - (02:47): You can upload it  
jfx - (02:50): I need to learn velocity, I think.  
jfx - (02:50): I can get rid of other blank lines too, but I've no idea if they are justified.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:51): I like adding space to my code so I just comment it all out.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:51): ##  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:51): like that.  
sdumitriu - (02:52): Huh? Actually I can't find any other document where XWikiTeam is used  
sdumitriu - (02:52): Did I dream that it's supposed to be used/  
sdumitriu - (02:52): ?  
sdumitriu - (02:53): OK, I'll just apply it when it's ready  
sdumitriu - (02:55): CalebJamesDeLisl: Still having trouble with Hudson?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:56): I think my tests are just weak.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:56): on a pentium4 everything has plenty of time to load :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:15): sdumitriu: do you use gedit? (I have a nice velocity code highlight file.)  
sdumitriu - (03:15): Kate  
sdumitriu - (03:15): (KDE user)  
jfx - (03:17): Okay, done. Got rid of two more blank lines, and it does not seem to break anything.  
jfx - (03:18): but I can't really tell. {{info}}$msg.get('xe.index.trash.documents.empty'){{/info}} does not display anything even when I get zero hits.  
jfx - (03:22): eh, I'll just leave them. Might be intentional  
jfx - (03:23):  #if($deletedAttachments == 0)  
jfx - (03:23):     
jfx - (03:23):     {{info}}$msg.get('xe.index.trash.attachments.empty'){{/info}}  
jfx - (03:23):       
jfx - (03:23):   #else  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:25): sdumitriu: You know that getXMLEncoded() converts single quotes into parentheses right?  see: XWIKI-4972  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:26): $escapetool.html() does not though.  
sdumitriu - (03:26): You mean apostrophes?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:26): Yes that one...  
sdumitriu - (03:27): Yeah, don't know exactly why  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:27): apache CharacterFilter bug/feature  
sdumitriu - (03:28): jfx: The blank lines around {{info}} are needed  
jfx - (03:29): I suspected. It's reverted.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:30): Another thing, I also have a greasemonkey script for running google prittifier which I hacked to be able to highlight raw source from svn, so when I'm reading CharacterFilter.java, it's highlighted.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:31): (couldn't find any decent syntax highlighting firefox addon.)  
sdumitriu - (03:31): Cool!  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:33): I'll send a copy, the hack is pretty neat, it reads the pre element which firefox forces the document into and with a document.write() it puts it back with class=prettyprint then lets prittifier do it's job.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:34): Must execute on page load event, It can't execute too early or too late (not entirely sure why)  
sdumitriu left at 03:39 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds

headache - (09:23): hi  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:26  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 10:42  
headache - (10:45): how to run xwiki inside eclipse?  
headache - (10:46): i've read the reference which says run as <maven goal>  
headache - (10:46): i've checked out xwiki enterprise trunk  
headache - (10:49): it seems that every maven goal builds xwiki however there are no source files in folders  
headache - (10:50): if i would editate some sources and see what happen?  
\_\_\_Gaurav joined #xwiki at 10:54  
\_\_\_Gaurav - (10:54): Hello Folks  
\_\_\_Gaurav left #xwiki at 10:55  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 11:23  
sdumitriu - (11:30): vmassol: What do you want to do about the proposed GSoC projects? Send a [VOTE] email or leave them as they are? It's getting pretty late  
headache - (11:30): someone use eclipse?  
vmassol - (11:31): sdumitriu: do we have a mentor for each?  
vmassol - (11:31): I don't think it's useful to have projects for which we don't have any declared mentor  
sdumitriu - (11:31): Some people volunteered for some projects  
vmassol - (11:32): so provided someone express desire for a project then I think this project should be allowed to be proposed  
vmassol - (11:32): the real vote will be when we get the number of slot allocations and we have to make choices  
vmassol - (11:32): so I'd say we should find mentors now for the propose project and make those projects avail to students (as a proposal)  
vmassol - (11:32): wdyt?  
sdumitriu - (11:34): Well, maybe you should make the call, nobody seems to listen to me  
vmassol - (11:34): I can try  
vmassol - (11:34): sending email  
vmassol - (11:36): we have some time though  
vmassol - (11:36): it's from march 8 to march 29  
sdumitriu - (11:36): Not quite  
sdumitriu - (11:37): A good project list should be available for the orgqanisation selection phase  
vmassol - (11:38): we have that list already  
vmassol - (11:38): so that's taken care of  
vmassol - (11:39): ah you mean in google's application  
sdumitriu - (11:40): Yes, that's what I mean  
vmassol - (11:41): btw the links don't work for me  
vmassol - (11:41): on our gsoc page  
vmassol - (11:41): for projects  
sdumitriu - (11:41): What links?  
vmassol - (11:42): links under proposed projects  
vmassol - (11:42): (in the list)  
vmassol - (11:43): livedata macro is a small project isn't it?  
sdumitriu - (11:43): I fixed it once, did somebody revert the document?  
sdumitriu - (11:43): Or override my changes?  
sdumitriu - (11:43): No, not at all  
vmassol - (11:43): I thought we had a project for writing macros  
vmassol - (11:43): (several of them)  
sdumitriu - (11:43): So far both Asiri and JVelo tried to do it but didn't succeed  
sdumitriu - (11:43): It takes too much time  
vmassol - (11:43): not really  
vmassol - (11:43): it's about 1 week of work  
sdumitriu - (11:43): Yes, really  
vmassol - (11:44): they have never started  
sdumitriu - (11:44): Did you read the project description?  
sdumitriu - (11:44): It's not about switching the current code to a macro  
vmassol - (11:44): ok  
sdumitriu - (11:44): It's about making a very flexible component  
vmassol - (11:45): I was deceived by "\* Make it a 2.0 wiki macro instead of a velocity macro"  
vmassol - (11:45): I'll rewrite  
vmassol - (11:47): hmm re member directory we need it sooner than later… I'd have preferred if we did this internally  
vmassol - (11:47): sdumitriu: do we have a project for autocompletion in editors?  
sdumitriu - (11:48): No  
vmassol - (11:48): wdyt?  
vmassol - (11:48): good idea?  
sdumitriu - (11:48): Yes  
vmassol - (11:48): ok I'll add one, is it large enough?  
sdumitriu - (11:50): I think so  
headache - (11:52): it's all about web development... :|  
sdumitriu - (11:54): Well, it's a web application  
sdumitriu - (11:54): But not all are about web development  
vmassol - (11:54): sdumitriu: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/#HAutoCompletioninContentEditors  
vmassol - (11:55): headache: the wiki importer is not about web dev for ex  
sdumitriu - (11:55): XOO  
sdumitriu - (11:55): Export to Word/PDF  
vmassol - (11:56): I put active yes  
vmassol - (11:57): should be no?  
sdumitriu - (11:57): Security Improvements  
sdumitriu - (11:58): I'm not sure  
sdumitriu - (11:59): I forgot what that field is for  
vmassol - (12:00): yes dpeends what we mean by it  
vmassol - (12:00): I think it meant  
vmassol - (12:01): that the project was chosen  
vmassol - (12:01): so we should put no for now  
vmassol - (12:01): only issue is that students might think this project is not to be chosen  
vmassol - (12:01): we should change the label maybe  
mflorea left at 12:11 (Quit: Leaving.  
headache - (12:12): i'm stuck :(  
\_\_\_Gaurav joined #xwiki at 12:18  
\_\_\_Gaurav - (12:19): Hello friends  
\_\_\_Gaurav - (12:20): just I want to know that do people really want to integrate xwiki and Google wave or twitter  
\_\_\_Gaurav - (12:21): I am quite interested in the project and want to start with xwiki  
vmassol - (12:24): cool  
\_\_\_Gaurav - (12:27): actually I am developing an desktop application in flex for twitter, with rich user interface and some extra functionalities  
\_\_\_Gaurav - (12:27): like tweet notification via sms and voice mail, and reply, tweet and retweet functionality using sms  
\_\_\_Gaurav - (12:28): so just wondering how much it would be useful for xwiki to integrate it with xWiki  
\_\_\_Gaurav - (12:30): I am a final year student and having good understanding of J2SE, j2EE, Flex, C, C++, Databases, Twitter APIs  
sdumitriu - (12:32): Well, we're not really fond of Flex  
\_\_\_Gaurav - (12:32): thats not a problem  
\_\_\_Gaurav - (12:33): I am very good at J2EE and will be doing same in JAVA  
\_\_\_Gaurav - (12:33): if its really useful for xwiki  
\_\_\_Gaurav - (12:34): I have developed one application for Internet banking  
\_\_\_Gaurav - (12:35): just want to know importance of the idea?  
jfx - (12:39): That is really hard to answer.  
\_\_\_Gaurav - (12:41): importance as in, will it be in priority list of xwiki?  
sdumitriu - (13:04): jfx: Ping  
jfx - (13:04): pong?  
sdumitriu - (13:05): Joel Forsberg, right?  
jfx - (13:05): It's true  
sdumitriu - (13:05): K  
sdumitriu - (13:05): Just wanted to check so that I credit the right person  
jfx - (13:05): Yay, thanks.  
sdumitriu - (13:06): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-614 applied  
jfx - (13:10): sdumitriu: I asked you on the users list about a case when rdoc.displayTitle didnt work, but I'm not sure if it was answered.  
jfx - (13:12): Afaik all the ugly stuff happens because of the title field bug. (which I'll file bug, and start investigate now)  
\_\_\_Gaurav left at 13:18 (Remote host closed the connection  
sdumitriu - (13:20): jfx: Which one?  
jfx - (13:25): A case where rdoc.displayTitle will not work but getXMLEncoded(rdoc.render(plain)) will.  
jfx - (13:25): (..or did you mean title field not escaping html)  
jfx - (13:29): Im referring to the last paragraph of this mail http://lists.xwiki.org/pipermail/users/2010-March/019797.html. But I see now that I didnt really ask what I meant to ask.  
jfx - (13:30): >\_<  
jfx - (13:39): Okay I'll try phrase it right now.  
jfx - (13:43): Hm.. actually.  
jfx - (13:43): I see now. It's the {pre} stuff. That does not work with rdoc.displayTitle

sdumitriu - (15:01): Hi  
Nirmal - (15:01): I'm interested in XWiki  
Nirmal - (15:01): as a GSoC project  
Nirmal - (15:01): So,  
Nirmal - (15:01): is there anyone that can provide me some help?  
Nirmal - (15:02): I'm interested in this idea http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/#HExportToWordPDFthroughOpenOffice  
Nirmal - (15:03): But having some questions on the idea  
headache - (15:03): i can help you building XWiki from sources  
headache - (15:03): maybe it's better to play a bit with XWiki  
Nirmal - (15:04): since I'm new to XWiki it will be great  
Nirmal - (15:04): yeah..  
Nirmal - (15:04): Can you please explain me where to start from?  
headache - (15:05): wait :) i get some reference for yo  
Nirmal - (15:05): thank you !!  
Nirmal - (15:05): btw I like to introduce my self to you  
headache - (15:05): i'm a student like you  
headache - (15:05): :D  
Nirmal - (15:05): ok... den  
Nirmal - (15:06): :D  
Nirmal - (15:06): im from Sri Lanka  
Nirmal - (15:06): where are u frm?  
headache - (15:06): i'm from Italy  
Nirmal - (15:07): k :)  
headache - (15:07): then look here http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  
Nirmal - (15:07): k..  
headache - (15:08): you need subversion and maven in order to get and build XWiki from sources  
headache - (15:08): Nirmal, which OS do you use?  
marta1 joined #xwiki at 15:08  
Nirmal - (15:09): Vista  
headache - (15:09): ok for windows there's tortoise svn  
Nirmal - (15:09): k..  
headache - (15:10): a subversion client that integrates in windows explorer shell  
headache - (15:10): http://tortoisesvn.tigris.org/  
Nirmal - (15:10): ok thanks  
headache - (15:11): http://maven.apache.org/  
Nirmal - (15:11): I'll download Maven 2.2.1  
headache - (15:11): yes :) here find some instructions http://maven.apache.org/download.html  
Nirmal - (15:12): ok  
headache - (15:12): you need to set some environment variables  
headache - (15:12): it's all documented  
headache - (15:12): if you have troubles ask  
Nirmal - (15:12): ok... thanks !!  
headache - (15:13): we can see together how to resolve :)  
Nirmal - (15:13): great :)  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 15:13  
Nirmal - (15:14): By the way, may I know your name?  
headache - (15:14): yes my name is Giuseppe  
Nirmal - (15:14): ok...  
headache - (15:14): in english is Joseph  
Nirmal - (15:14): ah...ok  
Nirmal - (15:15): Is it ok if I called you as Joseph?  
headache - (15:15): yes no problem  
Nirmal - (15:15): thanks,  
Nirmal - (15:16):  Joseph, had u participated in previous GSoCs?  
headache - (15:16): no this is my first time  
Nirmal - (15:16): that's great, mine too  
Nirmal - (15:17): You doing a BSc degree? or else?  
headache - (15:17): yeah bachelor degree in computer science  
Nirmal - (15:18): ok...  
headache - (15:18): and you Nirmal what are you studying in Sri Lanka?  
Nirmal - (15:18): What's the IRC client you're using?  
Nirmal - (15:19): I'm doing BSc in Computer Science & Engineering, at University of Moratuwa  
headache - (15:19): xchat, Nirmal use your time to speak about XWiki  
Nirmal - (15:19): ok.  
headache - (15:19): i think this no place to talk about personal questions :D

Nirmal - (15:27): so that's easy

Nirmal\_ joined #xwiki at 15:29  
Nirmal\_ left at 15:29 (Client Quit  
Nirmal joined #xwiki at 15:30  
Nirmal - (15:30): Hi Joseph, I'm back in XChat  
Nirmal - (15:31): I'm Nirmal  
headache - (15:32): ok now that you have svn and maven  
headache - (15:32): look here http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building

headache - (15:33): ok  
headache - (15:34): then you should first install maven and set environment variables  
Nirmal - (15:34): Meantime I am reading how to run Maven in the link you gave

headache - (15:35): ok  
sdumitriu - (15:41): mflorea: Do you know why you did this?  
sdumitriu - (15:41): ${docStats.space}.$docStats.name.replaceAll('@', '%40')  
sdumitriu - (15:41): Asking about the replace  
mflorea - (15:41): sdumitriu: let me read  
sdumitriu - (15:42): That's in Stats.Macros  
mflorea - (15:42): let me see the code, I don't remember..  
mflorea - (15:47): I don't remember why. Maybe @ is a special link symbol in xwiki/1.0 syntax (e.g. prevent the name from being considered an email address), but then why did I escape only this character.  
Nirmal - (15:48): Hi Joseph  
sdumitriu - (15:48): mflorea: OK, I hope I won't break anything  
headache - (15:49): Nirmal, i read you  
Nirmal - (15:49): I got an error while I tried to extract the zip in Vista  
Nirmal - (15:49): I've WinRar  
headache - (15:49): which error?  
Nirmal - (15:50): so how can I unzip it  
headache - (15:50): in what format you have downloaded maven?  
Nirmal - (15:50): .zip  
Nirmal - (15:50): there's no .rar  
Nirmal - (15:51): as I saw  
sdumitriu - (15:51): Well, Vista has integrated support for zip  
headache - (15:51): sdumitriu, is right :D  
mflorea - (15:51): sdumitriu: I just did a test and if I write "[foo>ab]" in a xwiki/1,0 page then a link to Space.ab is created. If I write "[foo>a@b]" then no link is created.  
headache - (15:51): however consider to use 7zip is supports all compression format  
sdumitriu - (15:52): mflorea: But @ should not be valid in a page name in the first place  
sdumitriu - (15:52): And that's supposed to be a page name

Nirmal - (16:21): Joseph, you have a clear idea about that proposal?  
Nirmal - (16:22): I'm not sure, why XWiki need to export PDFs through OpenOffice?  
MichelleShi - (16:23): Nirmal, I think it's because the fonts problem with no-latin language.  
sdumitriu - (16:24): Nope  
sdumitriu - (16:24): The current PDF export works well with most languages  
Nirmal - (16:25): sdumitriu, can you please explain that requirement? http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/#HExportToWordPDFthroughOpenOffice  
sdumitriu - (16:25): Well, we have a PDF export which can handle wiki documents  
sdumitriu - (16:26): But it can't handle attachments  
sdumitriu - (16:26): So a requirement will be to:  
sdumitriu - (16:27): If a document has attachments of one of the supported types (mostly office documents), then it should be possible to export that attachment as PDF  
sdumitriu - (16:27): Through OpenOffice  
sdumitriu - (16:28): Another aspect is export to Word format  
Nirmal - (16:29): ok. But can't we modify the current PDF exporter as it able to handle attachments too?  
sdumitriu - (16:29): Currently we have export to PDF, HTML, RTF  
sdumitriu - (16:29): It should also be possible to export to .docx and .odf  
sdumitriu - (16:29): Nope  
MichelleShi - (16:30): OpenOffice is very powerful to support all the document type.  
sdumitriu - (16:30): The current PDF exporter is based on XSL-FO  
Nirmal - (16:30): ok...  
Nirmal - (16:30): Is it Apache FOP?  
MichelleShi - (16:30): and it's supported by oo community and sun.  
sdumitriu - (16:31): It would be a very hard job to convert .doc to XML, trasform through xslt to xsl-fo, then transform the fo to pdf  
sdumitriu - (16:31): Yes, Apache FOP  
sdumitriu - (16:31): MichelleShi is right, OOo is much more powerful at converting between formats  
Nirmal - (16:32): ok..  
headache - (16:33): the trick is to use openoffice api to create docx or odf document
